instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00034: What is 820-00034? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.820-0034: What is 820-0034? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
Hi guys,

I have iMac 21,5 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A logic board that doesnt turn on.

1st led is on.

G3 Rails are present,

<SIGNAL>PP12V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V_S5</SIGNAL> are presents too.

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is 0V ( i have anothet working Mac with same board and <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL> good is also 0V in S5)


Any idea? What else i have to meausure. Tried SMC bypass not running.



P.S: <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL> is present 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL> is present 3.3V"
Then all S4 voltages should be present too; confirm that.
If not, check for short at all S4 power rails; especially L7650.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message: I see only 2 s4 voltages. PP5V and PP3V3 and both are not shorted and present when power supply connected. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> - 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message: Also there is something happening that i have discovered just now. When plug cable iMac is entering s0 state, but no fan spins and only first led is on When press and hold power button for few seconds all s0 rails back to 0V again. The only rail missing is <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> ( not shorted to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
Check <CHIP>U7490</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8440</CHIP> voltages.
Second LED requires <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> presence.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7490</CHIP>

Pin 1,2,3,5 are 0V Pin 4 is 3.2 and Pin 6 1,8.

<CHIP>U8440</CHIP> board doesnt have it. I can see it in pdf too, but there is no componenten <CHIP>U8440</CHIP> on it. 


P.S: <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> was getting very hot. I removed it for now. Do you thinkg it can make machine not to turn on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
<CHIP>U8440</CHIP> pads look untouched?
It wasn't ripped off?
<CAPACITOR>C8440</CAPACITOR> is there?
Do you get <SIGNAL>P3V3_S0_FET</SIGNAL> output voltage?

Check for short (or low value) at <CAPACITOR>C6203</CAPACITOR>.
Board should start if <RESISTOR>R6200</RESISTOR> removed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message: No informaticos, there is just no pads.  Will attach photo tomorrow. It's strange because it's not "NO STUFF" just there is no componentes and pads there. WIll check all u wrote tomorrow. Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
So the board doesn't correspond with schematic.

What about the other things mentioned in my previous post?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
sure, will do it tomorrow as promised:) thanks

P.S: at least in pdf there is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> mentioned in text so it's very strange

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
So i have checked and: 

it wasnt ripped off 

there is no <CAPACITOR>C8440</CAPACITOR> 

<CAPACITOR>C6203</CAPACITOR> has low resistance to ground 120 OHMS ( checked with working logic board and it must have about 120Khoms). 

There is no <RESISTOR>R6200</RESISTOR>. If you mean <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> the board doesnt start with that removed. 


Also <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> seems to be blown. Dont have donor board so will wait untill it arrives me from China. Will back once put it again. Thank you 2Informaticos.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message: I have recieved the <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> and changed it. Again got 1.5V on  <SIGNAL>PP4V5_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL> and almost shorted with 100 Ohms resistance to ground. Checked all and finally removed <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> now get 4.5 instead of 1.5V and resistance to ground is ok. The question is, will iMac turn on without <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
If is only audio circuit, board should start without it.
Nothing bad can happen if you try...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
PP12V is ok
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.4V

<SIGNAL>PP12V_S5</SIGNAL> - 12V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.3V


<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> -5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> 3.3V

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3</SIGNAL> - 1.8V
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> - 1.19V

The board is going to S0 state ( but only first led on it is on). So


<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0</SIGNAL> - 12V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 5V


<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> - 0V and nod shorted to ground. Checking line there is nothing wrong i can see using microscope It's not generated because of <CHIP>U8440</CHIP> doesnt sent enable signal to <CHIP>U7490</CHIP>. The problem is that schematic and boardview i have there is no <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> on real board. Already checked all avialable on internet and all are same.

P.S. I Found it. it's on the other side of the board near where it must be on boardview. If someone in the future check schematic will need this info. Now will continue checking.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message: Any idea what it can be? All is ok except of <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL>. The board is entering S0 mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message: Already changed <CHIP>U8420</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
Changed <CHIP>U8420</CHIP> why?
You had correct <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL>.

Post <CHIP>U8440</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7490</CHIP> voltages...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
Measermunt are done with board in S0 state because when i connect power it enters in that state automaticly.


<CHIP>U8440</CHIP>:

1 - 3.3 V
2 - 5V
3- 0V
4- GND
5 - 3.3V
6 - 0V
7 . 3.3V
8 - 3.3V

<CHIP>U7490</CHIP>

1,2,3 - 0V
4 - 3.3V
5 - 0V
6 - 1.8V


Pin 3 of <CHIP>U7490</CHIP> is what make me think that <CHIP>U8440</CHIP> is bad ( i was wrong in my previous post it was <CHIP>U8440</CHIP> changed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message: Solved. It was <SIGNAL>PP3V_S0</SIGNAL> low value due <CHIP>U8400</CHIP>. Changed not it seems to work. Will assemble it tomorrow and confirm. Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on
threads.message:
Fine. Now it's working all is ok but there is a problem with image. 

There are points that appear always over grey colour. I have already tried new displays, no change and tried this imac's display on other imac and its working fine so it's something on logic board. 


Attaching images so u can see. 

Any idea what it can be?

threads.message:
RAM is soldered onboard?
In such case, can you find some program for testing RAM?
However, reflow seems to be last option...

threads.message: yes, it's integrated.Will try ram check. (AHT doesnt do it in full test mode?)
